examples: therapeutic intervention to ablate existing cancer cells

verb.description: Gradually remove material from or erode (a surface or object) by melting, evaporation, frictional action, etc., or erode (material) in this way.
examples: drying winds slowly ablate away the ice
the laser beam can ablate solid rock from seven metres away

origin: Late 15th century (in the general sense take away, remove): from Latin ablat- taken away (see ablation).
